summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, alleging massive, ongoing accounting fraud and market manipulation by Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE), facilitated by SEC corruption and obstruction. Dilorio claims NITE's core business is abusive naked short selling of OTC market shells to facilitate money laundering, and that the SEC has actively covered up these activities while retaliating against him.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making detailed allegations of securities fraud, market manipulation, and SEC corruption related to Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE) and other entities.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: Primary recipient of Dilorio's emails, accused of failing to distribute his information and obstructing his whistleblower claims.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's emails, implicated in the alleged obstruction of his whistleblower claims.

persons.name: Lara Shalov Mehraban
persons.context: SEC attorney accused by Dilorio of criminal obstruction due to her alleged prior professional relationship with Dougie Cifu of Virtu Financial.

persons.name: Dougie Cifu
persons.context: Referred to as 'Dougie Large,' former Paul Weiss colleague/boss of Lara Mehraban and current executive at Virtu Financial (NITE). Allegedly paying Mehraban to obstruct investigations.

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: Former SEC Chairman accused by Dilorio of not disclosing conflicts of interest related to his former firm Sullivan & Cromwell's work for NITE.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Attorney at Sullivan & Cromwell, alleged by Dilorio to have played a key role in keeping NITE/Virtu operational.

persons.name: Alex Ioffe
persons.context: CFO at Virtu Financial hired by Dougie Cifu in 2019; previously CFO at Interactive Brokers (IBKR) during the period covered by an SEC complaint.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.context: Former Trump campaign manager and board member at NITE (Virtu) and FSD Pharma (HUGE), implicated in alleged pump-and-dump schemes.

persons.name: Stephen Schwarzman
persons.context: Referred to as 'Schwarzy,' CEO of Blackstone. Alleged to be a key facilitator in perpetuating Knight/KCG/Virtu, connected to Trump, Kushner, and Epstein, and involved in the Kodak (KODK) 'pump'.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.context: Alleged 'Bag Man' and CEO of Blink Charging (BLNK), formerly New Image Concepts. Accused of involvement in money laundering shells and escaping SEC action on Skyway.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Alleged Trump fundraiser and Epstein business partner, linked to Michael Farkas and the BLNK fraud.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Former New Mexico Governor linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his Zorro Ranch, mentioned in connection to the BLNK fraud.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Alleged 'Bag Man' involved with Hanover/Magna in entities like CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas. Subject of an SEC complaint regarding bogus notes, which Dilorio claims is based on his information.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged 'Bag Man' associated with JMJ, barred by FINRA in 2013 but allegedly still active in 2019 with Blink Charging (BLNK).

persons.name: Oleg Firer
persons.context: Referred to as 'His Eminence,' a prolific 'Bag Man' linked to Jaclin money laundering shells, Allied Wallet, and WireCard.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Investor linked to Jaclin money laundering shells (e.g., PRComplete/YESDtc) in SEC complaints.

persons.name: Bisgay
persons.context: Former CFO of KCG who resigned with two weeks left in a quarter and did not certify financials, mentioned in the context of the 'FCM business sale' to Wedbush.

persons.name: Sean P. Galvin
persons.context: Individual who certified KCG financials along with 'Coleman' after CFO Bisgay's resignation.

persons.name: Bill Scigliano
persons.context: Chairman of the board at Acies Corp (Oleg Firer's entity) and also a director at YESDtc Holdings (a Jaclin shell).

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, subject of an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump promotion of Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, subject of an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump promotion of Net Element (NETE).

connections.description: Alleged former colleagues/boss-employee relationship at law firm Paul Weiss. Dilorio accuses Mehraban of being paid by Cifu to criminally obstruct SEC investigations into NITE/Virtu.
Both associated with the law firm Sullivan & Cromwell ('Sull Crom'). Dilorio alleges they used their positions to protect client NITE/Virtu from investigation.
Cifu hired Ioffe as CFO of Virtu Financial in 2019. Ioffe was previously CFO at Interactive Brokers.
Described as 'BFF's' (best friends forever). Schwarzman is also connected to Kushner and Epstein, and is alleged to be on the SEC's 'Do not investigate List'.
Urban was Trump's Pennsylvania campaign manager and is on the board of NITE (Virtu Financial).
Implied to be related (possibly brothers). Both are involved in alleged fraudulent schemes, with Jonathan being a Trump fundraiser and Epstein associate.
Both are labeled 'Bag Men' by Dilorio and are linked to the same money laundering shells, including Blink Charging (BLNK).
Scigliano is Chairman of the board at Firer's company, Acies Corp. Both are linked to Jaclin-related money laundering shells.
Whistleblower versus SEC official. Dilorio repeatedly accuses Janey of failing to distribute his information, obstructing investigations, and fabricating the denial of his award application.
Both are described as 'Bag Men' involved in similar schemes involving convertible notes and money laundering shells, with their activities detailed in Dilorio's TCRs.

events.title: Knight Capital Trading Glitch
events.description: A trading glitch at Knight Capital Group caused its stock to collapse from over $10.30 to nearly $2.50. Allegedly orchestrated with the help of the SEC, JEF, GS, and Blackstone, which had considered buying Knight before the glitch.

events.title: Dilorio's Initial TCR Filed
events.description: Christopher Dilorio filed a Tip, Complaint, or Referral (TCR) with the SEC, detailing allegations of illegal naked shorting, accounting fraud, and money laundering at Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (NITE).

events.title: SEC Jaclin 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against Jaclin et al., detailing a 'shell factory' operation involving companies like New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging).

events.title: SEC Charges UBS with AML Violations
events.description: The SEC announced settled charges against UBS Financial Services Inc. for failing to report suspicious transactions, resulting in a $5 million penalty. Dilorio claims this case is based on his information.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: The SEC brought a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC and the Tandon brothers for pump-and-dump schemes, including promotion of Net Element (NETE) in 2018.

events.title: SEC Approves BLNK Public Offering
events.description: Despite Dilorio's warnings, the SEC declared effective a public offering for Blink Charging Co. (BLNK), which he alleges is a money laundering shell.

events.title: BLNK Press Release Pump
events.description: Blink Charging issued a press release about a grant for charging stations, driving its stock up ~30% on high volume. Dilorio alleges this was a fraudulent pump-and-dump with no corresponding 8-K filing.

events.title: HUGE (FSD Pharma) Stock Surge
events.description: FSD Pharma (HUGE), a pot company with David Urban on its board, surged over 100% on news of pivoting to a COVID-19 cure. Dilorio alleges this is an SEC-facilitated pump-and-dump for money laundering.

events.title: Virtu Financial 2Q2020 Earnings Report
events.description: Virtu Financial (NITE) reported 2Q2020 earnings, showing receivables of $2.44 billion, which Dilorio alleges are fraudulent liabilities from naked short fails.

events.title: Dilorio's August 2020 Fraud Alert
events.description: Dilorio sent emails alerting the SEC that NITE (Virtu) was 'GROSSLY insolvent' as of August 18, 2020, due to ongoing accounting fraud from abusive naked shorting.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges that Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (entity referred to as NITE) is a criminal enterprise whose core business is abusive naked short selling of OTC market shells to facilitate money laundering.

Dilorio claims the SEC, including officials Janey, Hoecker, and Lara Mehraban, has engaged in criminal obstruction by covering up his allegations, facilitating the fraud, and retaliating against him as a whistleblower.

Specific allegations include that NITE's reported multi-billion dollar 'receivables' are actually liabilities from failed settlements due to illegal naked short positions, making the company insolvent.

The emails connect the alleged financial fraud to prominent political figures (Trump, Kushner), financiers (Stephen Schwarzman of Blackstone), and associates of Jeffrey Epstein (Jonathan Farkas, Bill Richardson).

Dilorio references multiple specific companies as examples of 'money laundering shells' used in pump-and-dump schemes, including Blink Charging (BLNK), Net Element (NETE), FSD Pharma (HUGE), and Eastman Kodak (KODK), all allegedly facilitated by SEC inaction or approval.
